intro: Operculina turpethum var. humilior, commonly known as the small operculina, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, herbaceous stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
